Comments_List: Learned about what ethnography was and how it differs from other fields within Sociology.
I developed the knowledge, skills, and insights needed to become an urban ethnographer.

I learned that Ethnography is the systematic study of culture and that it is important to "get in" with your subjects. Though "getting in" is an organic process and very hard to definitively layout the process.

Strengths: Learned about a variety of current ethnographic studies
Weakness: Would have liked more time to engage with the presenters.
Dr. Anderson is the premier expert in urban ethnography. Only strengths, no weaknesses.
Although this was a speakers series, I thought more class that discussed the ins and outs of ethnography would have been very useful for first time students in this field.
Yes. It was a great survey course. I enjoyed the professor's candor and insight into the field.
Yes, only if you are serious about ethnography.
yes, i think methodologically this class is very useful
